com.conceptwave.scripting
Class BenchmarkCounter

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.BenchmarkCounter

public class BenchmarkCounter
extends CWScriptable

Title:

Description: The benchmark counter is a tool for performance monitoring. It can count given events and their duration as well as keeps histogram information - the number of events and average duration per 1 minutes interval for a given maximum interval

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2001

Company:

Constructor Detail

BenchmarkCounter

public BenchmarkCounter()
Method Detail

clean

public void clean()
Resets the benchmark counter object erasing all data

endHistogram

public void endHistogram()
Stops the histogram data collection. Stopping of already stopped historic data collection does not have any effect.

getDurations

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer[] getDurations()
Returns the current histogram average duration array. The element of the array represent the average duration of the event per minute intervals starting from the histogram start time.

Returns:
Array of integers or null of the data collection is not started

getHistogram

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer[] getHistogram()
Returns the current histogram event array. The element of the array represent the number of events per minute intervals starting from the histogram start time.

Returns:
Array of integers or null of the data collection is not started

getHistogramEndTime

public Date getHistogramEndTime()
Returns end time of the current historic data as date object.

Returns:
The end date or null if no historic data exists

getHistogramSize

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getHistogramSize()
Gets the size of the histogram data (in number of minutes from the histogram start date). This is the same of the number of elements of the histogram array

Returns:
The Time of the current histogram start or null if histogram data is not collected.

getHistogramStartTime

public Date getHistogramStartTime()
Gets the historic data start time as Date object

Returns:
The Time of the current histogram start or null if histogram data is not collected.

increment

public java.lang.Long increment(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer events,
                                com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer duration)
Increment the benchmark counter. The increment is automatically recorded in the current histogram interval if data collection is on. The data collection intervals are a minute long and the size of the collection interval can be specified when the collection is turned on. The counter collect number of events and average duration of an event data. The latter will not be collected if the increment API always specifies zero or negative duration.

Parameters:
events - Number of events. If 0 or negative, value of 1 is assumed
Total - duration for the specified number of events. Can be 0 or negative if we don't want the counter to calculate and collect average duration for an event data.
Returns:
The value of the event counter after the increment

startCounting

public void startCounting()
Starts the counting. The counter content is set to 0. The old historic data (if any) is erased and if the historic data collection is on the collecting start time is reset to the current moment.

startHistogram

public void startHistogram(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer interval)
Starts/restarts collection of historic data. The historic data is collected in one minute intervals for maximum interval (default 24 hours) starting from the moment of this call. After the interval the historic data for the first half hour is erased, the collection start time is moved 30 minutes ahead and the collection continues.

Parameters:
interval - The maximum interval for the histogram. If not specified or 0 the default interval of one day is used. If specified should be at least 1 hour (60 minutes) and no more than 10080 minutes (one week) The histogram collection will not start if the counter is stopped

stopCounting

public void stopCounting()
Stops counting. After this API calls to increment counter API are ignored until the counter is cleared using clean API. Sets the counter end time. Stops the histogram data collection.
